statements: SELECT * FROM adaptive_learning_algorithms;
SELECT student_name, course_name, performance_score FROM adaptive_learning_algorithms WHERE student_id = 1;
SELECT course_name, student_name, performance_score FROM adaptive_learning_algorithms WHERE course_id = 101;
SELECT student_name, performance_score, course_name FROM adaptive_learning_algorithms WHERE performance_score > 80;
SELECT course_name, AVG(performance_score) AS avg_score FROM adaptive_learning_algorithms GROUP BY course_name;
SELECT student_name, performance_score FROM adaptive_learning_algorithms WHERE course_id = 1 ORDER BY performance_score DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT * FROM adaptive_learning_algorithms WHERE course_name LIKE '%Math%' ORDER BY student_name ASC;
SELECT course_name, AVG(performance_score) AS avg_score FROM adaptive_learning_algorithms GROUP BY course_name HAVING AVG(performance_score) > 80;
SELECT DISTINCT(student_id), student_name FROM adaptive_learning_algorithms ORDER BY student_name DESC;
SELECT course_id, COUNT(*) AS num_students FROM adaptive_learning_algorithms GROUP BY course_id HAVING COUNT(*) >= 3;
SELECT * FROM student_scores
SELECT student_id, score FROM student_scores WHERE score > 80
SELECT performance_level, student_id FROM student_scores ORDER BY performance_level DESC
SELECT * FROM content WHERE topic = 'Math'
SELECT content_id, topic FROM content ORDER BY content_id DESC
SELECT * FROM student_scores WHERE score > 80
SELECT student_id, score, performance_level FROM student_scores WHERE performance_level = 'Good'
SELECT s.student_id, s.score, c.topic FROM student_scores s JOIN content c ON s.score > 80 AND c.difficulty_level = 'Intermediate'
SELECT DISTINCT performance_level FROM student_scores
SELECT * FROM student_scores ORDER BY score DESC LIMIT 3
SELECT * FROM students ORDER BY student_name ASC;
SELECT student_name, performance_score FROM students WHERE performance_score > 80;
SELECT student_id, student_name FROM students WHERE performance_score <= 60;
SELECT * FROM students WHERE student_id = 3;
SELECT COUNT(student_id) AS total_students FROM students;
SELECT student_name, performance_score FROM students WHERE student_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM students WHERE performance_score > 80 ORDER BY student_name DESC;
SELECT student_name, performance_score FROM students WHERE student_id >= 3 AND student_name LIKE '%A%' ORDER BY performance_score ASC;
SELECT COUNT(student_id) AS total_students, AVG(performance_score) AS avg_score FROM students;
SELECT student_name, performance_score FROM students WHERE student_name IN ('Alice', 'Bob', 'Mary') AND performance_score < 70 ORDER BY student_name ASC, performance_score DESC;
SELECT * FROM student_progress;
SELECT progress_value FROM student_progress WHERE student_id = '123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174000';
SELECT lesson_id, content FROM lesson_content ORDER BY lesson_id DESC;
SELECT accuracy, time_taken FROM performance_metrics WHERE student_id = '123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174001';
SELECT adaptive_level, difficulty_level FROM adaptive_content WHERE content_id = '123e4567-e89b-12d3-a456-426614174002';
SELECT student_id, progress_value FROM student_progress WHERE progress_value > 50;
SELECT student_id, content FROM lesson_content ORDER BY lesson_id DESC;
SELECT student_id, accuracy, time_taken FROM performance_metrics WHERE accuracy < 0.8 AND time_taken > 60;
SELECT content_id, adaptive_level, difficulty_level FROM adaptive_content WHERE adaptive_level >= 3 ORDER BY difficulty_level DESC;
SELECT * FROM student_progress JOIN performance_metrics ON student_progress.student_id = performance_metrics.student_id WHERE progress_value > 40 AND accuracy > 0.6;
SELECT * FROM students;
SELECT student_name, performance_score FROM students WHERE level > 2;
SELECT course_name, instructor, topic FROM courses WHERE course_id = 1;
SELECT student_name, result_status FROM students s JOIN student_assessment_results r ON s.student_id = r.student_id;
SELECT course_name, total_marks FROM courses c JOIN assessments a ON c.course_id = a.course_id WHERE assessment_type = 'Midterm';
SELECT * FROM students ORDER BY student_name DESC, level
SELECT student_name, level FROM students WHERE level > 2 AND performance_score > 80

SELECT student_name, course_name, progress_time FROM students s JOIN student_progress sp ON s.student_id = sp.student_id JOIN courses c ON sp.course_id = c.course_id WHERE progress_status = 'completed'
SELECT course_name, COUNT(assessment_id) AS total_assessments FROM courses c LEFT JOIN assessments a ON c.course_id = a.course_id GROUP BY course_name

SELECT s.student_name, a.assessment_type, sar.obtained_marks FROM students s JOIN student_assessment_results sar ON s.student_id = sar.student_id JOIN assessments a ON sar.assessment_id = a.assessment_id WHERE sar.result_status = 'pass'
